text:
After hours of deploying survey drones to check for access points, a lucky operator stumbles across a shuttle access port that isn’t locked down with shutters thicker than starship armor.

Traversing it is mind-numbingly boring, with rusted, ancient pipes being all there is to look at. A junction opens after what seems like ages – and it features a landing ramp and a maintenance access. Your crew immediately moves to set up a base camp.

This may become a longer operation. Where to next?

With the base camp established and the route clear, you trip to "Maintenance Central", as it has come to be known amongst your crew, is relatively quick and uneventful.

You are greeted by salvors hurrying between jobs to the sounds of hammer blows and distant gunfire as you step off the ramp. 

A servor bot helpfully presents the scheduled exploration party departures. Where to next?

The bustle of Salvage Central has not abated in the slightest. You are accosted from all sides by noise and smell alike - and, of course, by your trusty schedule helper bot.

Where to go?

You head towards the - clearly slacking - cargo salvage crew and are immediately greeted by the Chief.

"Yer back! We’ve been waitin’ patiently. What’cha got for us?"

He tries his best to cover for his crew trying to hide the evidence of their unscheduled break, failing terribly.
It is almost endearing.

There is nothing to do here but watch the comings and goings of the salvage parties. 

You do not spot - or hear - the chief. He is probably deeper down in the holds managing the extraction.
